Title: Data Flow HTTPS Is Potentially Interrupted
Description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.
Justificación: Protegido mediante el uso de HTTPS (REQS4), mitigando el riesgo de intercepción (RIDT).

Title: Spoofing of Source Data Store Load balancer
Description: Load balancer may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to incorrect data delivered to Web Application. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the source data store.

Title: Weak Access Control for a Resource
Description: Improper data protection of Load balancer can allow an attacker to read information not intended for disclosure. Review authorization settings.
Justificación: Control de acceso y políticas de mínimo privilegio implementadas (REQS1, REQS8).

Title: Web Application Process Memory Tampered
Description: If Web Application is given access to memory, such as shared memory or pointers, or is given the ability to control what Security Server executes (for example, passing back a function pointer.), then Web Application can tamper with Security Server. Consider if the function could work with less access to memory, such as passing data rather than pointers. Copy in data provided, and then validate it.
Justificación: Protección de integridad en backend y visualización mediante arquitectura desacoplada (REQS5).

Title: Replay Attacks
Description: Packets or messages without sequence numbers or timestamps can be captured and replayed in a wide variety of ways. Implement or utilize an existing communication protocol that supports anti-replay techniques (investigate sequence numbers before timers) and strong integrity.
Justificación: Protección contra reuso de tokens, incluido en prácticas de seguridad del JWT (REQS3).

Title: Collision Attacks
Description: Attackers who can send a series of packets or messages may be able to overlap data. For example, packet 1 may be 100 bytes starting at offset 0. Packet 2 may be 100 bytes starting at offset 25. Packet 2 will overwrite 75 bytes of packet 1. Ensure you reassemble data before filtering it, and ensure you explicitly handle these sorts of cases.
Justificación: Integridad de datos garantizada, evitando colisiones en procesamiento y almacenamiento (REQS5).

Title: Weak Authentication Scheme
Description: Custom authentication schemes are susceptible to common weaknesses such as weak credential change management, credential equivalence, easily guessable credentials, null credentials, downgrade authentication or a weak credential change management system. Consider the impact and potential mitigations for your custom authentication scheme.
Justificación: Autenticación segura con JWT RS256 (REQS3).

Title: Elevation Using Impersonation
Description: Security Server may be able to impersonate the context of Web Application in order to gain additional privilege.
Justificación: Autenticación fuerte y mínima exposición de credenciales (REQS3, REQS8).

Title: Visualization server Process Memory Tampered
Description: If Visualization server is given access to memory, such as shared memory or pointers, or is given the ability to control what Web Application executes (for example, passing back a function pointer.), then Visualization server can tamper with Web Application. Consider if the function could work with less access to memory, such as passing data rather than pointers. Copy in data provided, and then validate it.
Justificación: Protección de integridad en backend y visualización mediante arquitectura desacoplada (REQS5).

Description: Packets or messages without sequence numbers or timestamps can be captured and replayed in a wide variety of ways. Implement or utilize an existing communication protocol that supports anti-replay techniques (investigate sequence numbers before timers) and strong integrity.

Title: JavaScript Object Notation Processing
Description: If a dataflow contains JSON, JSON processing and hijacking threats may be exploited.

Title: Elevation Using Impersonation
Description: Visualization server may be able to impersonate the context of manager in order to gain additional privilege.
Justificación: Autenticación fuerte y mínima exposición de credenciales (REQS3, REQS8).

Title: JavaScript Object Notation Processing
Description: If a dataflow contains JSON, JSON processing and hijacking threats may be exploited.
Justificación: Validación y sanitización de entradas para prevenir inyecciones (REQS2, REQS9).

Title: Potential Data Repudiation by Web Application
Description: Web Application claims that it did not receive data from a source outside the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.
Justificación: Amenaza mitigada mediante controles definidos en SDL e ISO 12207.

Title: Weak Access Control for a Resource
Description: Improper data protection of Load balancer can allow an attacker to read information not intended for disclosure. Review authorization settings.
Justificación: Control de acceso y políticas de mínimo privilegio implementadas (REQS1, REQS8).

Title: Potential Process Crash or Stop for Web Application
Description: Web Application crashes, halts, stops or runs slowly; in all cases violating an availability metric.
Justificación: Amenaza mitigada mediante controles definidos en SDL e ISO 12207.

Title: Data Flow HTTPS Is Potentially Interrupted
Description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.
Justificación: Protegido mediante el uso de HTTPS (REQS4), mitigando el riesgo de intercepción (RIDT).

Title: Data Store Inaccessible
Description: An external agent prevents access to a data store on the other side of the trust boundary.

Title: Web Application May be Subject to Elevation of Privilege Using Remote Code Execution
Description: Load balancer may be able to remotely execute code for Web Application.
Justificación: Amenaza mitigada mediante controles definidos en SDL e ISO 12207.

Title: Elevation by Changing the Execution Flow in Web Application
Description: An attacker may pass data into Web Application in order to change the flow of program execution within Web Application to the attacker's choosing.
Justificación: Amenaza mitigada mediante controles definidos en SDL e ISO 12207.

Title: Spoofing of Source Data Store SQL Repository
Description: SQL Repository may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to incorrect data delivered to Security Server. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the source data store.
Justificación: Evaluación de riesgos y pruebas de seguridad para cada módulo nuevo (REQS10).

Title: Data Store Inaccessible
Description: An external agent prevents access to a data store on the other side of the trust boundary.
Justificación: Cifrado en reposo de información personal sensible (REQS4).

Title: Data Flow HTTPS Is Potentially Interrupted
Description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.
Justificación: Protegido mediante el uso de HTTPS (REQS4), mitigando el riesgo de intercepción (RIDT).

Title: Potential Excessive Resource Consumption for Web Application or Load balancer
Description: Does Web Application or Load balancer take explicit steps to control resource consumption? Resource consumption attacks can be hard to deal with, and there are times that it makes sense to let the OS do the job. Be careful that your resource requests don't deadlock, and that they do timeout.
Justificación: Mitigación de ataques de denegación de servicio a través de controles de rendimiento (REQS6).

Title: Authorization Bypass
Description: Can you access Load balancer and bypass the permissions for the object? For example by editing the files directly with a hex editor, or reaching it via filesharing? Ensure that your program is the only one that can access the data, and that all other subjects have to use your interface.
Justificación: Separación de funciones y control de permisos (REQS3, REQS8).

Title: Data Store Denies Load balancer Potentially Writing Data
Description: Load balancer claims that it did not write data received from an entity on the other side of the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.

Title: The Load balancer Data Store Could Be Corrupted
Description: Data flowing across HTTPS may be tampered with by an attacker. This may lead to corruption of Load balancer. Ensure the integrity of the data flow to the data store.

Title: Spoofing of Destination Data Store Load balancer
Description: Load balancer may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being written to the attacker's target instead of Load balancer. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the destination data store.
Justificación: Cifrado en reposo de información personal sensible (REQS4).

Title: Weak Access Control for a Resource
Description: Improper data protection of SQL Repository can allow an attacker to read information not intended for disclosure. Review authorization settings.
Justificación: Control de acceso y políticas de mínimo privilegio implementadas (REQS1, REQS8).

Title: Spoofing of Destination Data Store SQL Repository
Description: SQL Repository may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being written to the attacker's target instead of SQL Repository. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the destination data store.
Justificación: Evaluación de riesgos y pruebas de seguridad para cada módulo nuevo (REQS10).

Title: Potential SQL Injection Vulnerability for SQL Repository
Description: SQL injection is an attack in which malicious code is inserted into strings that are later passed to an instance of SQL Server for parsing and execution. Any procedure that constructs SQL statements should be reviewed for injection vulnerabilities because SQL Server will execute all syntactically valid queries that it receives. Even parameterized data can be manipulated by a skilled and determined attacker.
Justificación: Validación y sanitización de entradas para prevenir inyecciones (REQS2, REQS9).

Title: Authorization Bypass
Description: Can you access SQL Repository and bypass the permissions for the object? For example by editing the files directly with a hex editor, or reaching it via filesharing? Ensure that your program is the only one that can access the data, and that all other subjects have to use your interface.
Justificación: Separación de funciones y control de permisos (REQS3, REQS8).

Title: Weak Credential Storage
Description: Credentials held at the server are often disclosed or tampered with and credentials stored on the client are often stolen. For server side, consider storing a salted hash of the credentials instead of storing the credentials themselves. If this is not possible due to business requirements, be sure to encrypt the credentials before storage, using an SDL-approved mechanism. For client side, if storing credentials is required, encrypt them and protect the data store in which they're stored
Justificación: Autenticación segura con JWT RS256 (REQS3).

Title: Potential Excessive Resource Consumption for Security Server or SQL Repository
Description: Does Security Server or SQL Repository take explicit steps to control resource consumption? Resource consumption attacks can be hard to deal with, and there are times that it makes sense to let the OS do the job. Be careful that your resource requests don't deadlock, and that they do timeout.
Justificación: Mitigación de ataques de denegación de servicio a través de controles de rendimiento (REQS6).

Description: SQL Repository may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to incorrect data delivered to Web Application. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the source data store.
Justificación: Evaluación de riesgos y pruebas de seguridad para cada módulo nuevo (REQS10).

Description: Improper data protection of SQL Repository can allow an attacker to read information not intended for disclosure. Review authorization settings.

Description: SQL Repository may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being written to the attacker's target instead of SQL Repository. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the destination data store.

Justificación: Separación de funciones y control de permisos (REQS3, REQS8).

Description: Credentials held at the server are often disclosed or tampered with and credentials stored on the client are often stolen. For server side, consider storing a salted hash of the credentials instead of storing the credentials themselves. If this is not possible due to business requirements, be sure to encrypt the credentials before storage, using an SDL-approved mechanism. For client side, if storing credentials is required, encrypt them and protect the data store in which they're stored
Justificación: Autenticación segura con JWT RS256 (REQS3).

Title: Potential Excessive Resource Consumption for Web Application or SQL Repository
Description: Does Web Application or SQL Repository take explicit steps to control resource consumption? Resource consumption attacks can be hard to deal with, and there are times that it makes sense to let the OS do the job. Be careful that your resource requests don't deadlock, and that they do timeout.
Justificación: Mitigación de ataques de denegación de servicio a través de controles de rendimiento (REQS6).

Title: Spoofing the Authorization Provider External Entity
Description: Authorization Provider may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to unauthorized access to Visualization server. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the external entity.
Justificación: Separación de funciones y control de permisos (REQS3, REQS8).

Title: Elevation Using Impersonation
Description: Visualization server may be able to impersonate the context of Authorization Provider in order to gain additional privilege.
Justificación: Autenticación fuerte y mínima exposición de credenciales (REQS3, REQS8).

Title: JavaScript Object Notation Processing
Description: If a dataflow contains JSON, JSON processing and hijacking threats may be exploited.

Title: JavaScript Object Notation Processing
Description: If a dataflow contains JSON, JSON processing and hijacking threats may be exploited.

Title: JavaScript Object Notation Processing
Description: If a dataflow contains JSON, JSON processing and hijacking threats may be exploited.

Title: JavaScript Object Notation Processing
Description: If a dataflow contains JSON, JSON processing and hijacking threats may be exploited.
Justificación: Cifrado en reposo de información personal sensible (REQS4).

Title: Spoofing of Destination Data Store Monitoring Server
Description: Monitoring Server  may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being written to the attacker's target instead of Monitoring Server . Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the destination data store.
Justificación: Registro y monitoreo de eventos sensibles mediante SYSLOG (REQS7).

Title: Risks from Logging
Description: Log readers can come under attack via log files. Consider ways to canonicalize data in all logs. Implement a single reader for the logs, if possible, in order to reduce attack surface area. Be sure to understand and document log file elements which come from untrusted sources.
Justificación: Registro y monitoreo de eventos sensibles mediante SYSLOG (REQS7).

Title: Lower Trusted Subject Updates Logs
Description: If you have trust levels, is anyone other outside of the highest trust level allowed to log? Letting everyone write to your logs can lead to repudiation problems. Only allow trusted code to log.
Justificación: Registro y monitoreo de eventos sensibles mediante SYSLOG (REQS7).

Title: Data Logs from an Unknown Source
Description: Do you accept logs from unknown or weakly authenticated users or systems? Identify and authenticate the source of the logs before accepting them.
Justificación: Registro y monitoreo de eventos sensibles mediante SYSLOG (REQS7).

Title: Insufficient Auditing
Description: Does the log capture enough data to understand what happened in the past? Do your logs capture enough data to understand an incident after the fact? Is such capture lightweight enough to be left on all the time? Do you have enough data to deal with repudiation claims? Make sure you log sufficient and appropriate data to handle a repudiation claims. You might want to talk to an audit expert as well as a privacy expert about your choice of data.
Justificación: Registro y monitoreo de eventos sensibles mediante SYSLOG (REQS7).

Title: Potential Weak Protections for Audit Data
Description: Consider what happens when the audit mechanism comes under attack, including attempts to destroy the logs, or attack log analysis programs. Ensure access to the log is through a reference monitor, which controls read and write separately. Document what filters, if any, readers can rely on, or writers should expect
Justificación: Separación de funciones y control de permisos (REQS3, REQS8).

Title: Authorization Bypass
Description: Can you access Monitoring Server  and bypass the permissions for the object? For example by editing the files directly with a hex editor, or reaching it via filesharing? Ensure that your program is the only one that can access the data, and that all other subjects have to use your interface.
Justificación: Mitigación de ataques de denegación de servicio a través de controles de rendimiento (REQS6).

Title: Potential Excessive Resource Consumption for Security Server or Monitoring Server
Description: Does Security Server or Monitoring Server  take explicit steps to control resource consumption? Resource consumption attacks can be hard to deal with, and there are times that it makes sense to let the OS do the job. Be careful that your resource requests don't deadlock, and that they do timeout.
Justificación: Autenticación fuerte y mínima exposición de credenciales (REQS3, REQS8).

Title: Elevation Using Impersonation
Description: Visualization server may be able to impersonate the context of Event Administrator in order to gain additional privilege.

Title: External Entity Client Potentially Denies Receiving Data
Description: Client claims that it did not receive data from a process on the other side of the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.
Justificación: Cifrado en reposo de información personal sensible (REQS4).

Title: Spoofing of Source Data Store Load balancer
Description: Load balancer may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to incorrect data delivered to Client. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the source data store.
Justificación: Cifrado en reposo de información personal sensible (REQS4).

Description: An external agent prevents access to a data store on the other side of the trust boundary.
Justificación: Protegido mediante el uso de HTTPS (REQS4), mitigando el riesgo de intercepción (RIDT).

Description: An external agent interrupts data flowing across a trust boundary in either direction.
Justificación: Amenaza mitigada mediante controles definidos en SDL e ISO 12207.

Description: Load balancer claims that it did not write data received from an entity on the other side of the trust boundary. Consider using logging or auditing to record the source, time, and summary of the received data.

Description: Data flowing across HTTPS may be tampered with by an attacker. This may lead to corruption of Load balancer. Ensure the integrity of the data flow to the data store.
Justificación: Cifrado en reposo de información personal sensible (REQS4).

Description: Load balancer may be spoofed by an attacker and this may lead to data being written to the attacker's target instead of Load balancer. Consider using a standard authentication mechanism to identify the destination data store.
Justificación: Cifrado en reposo de información personal sensible (REQS4).

Title: Data Store Inaccessible
Description: An external agent prevents access to a data store on the other side of the trust boundary.
Justificación: Cifrado en reposo de información personal sensible (REQS4).
